meanings.definition: A person who uses profane language.
meanings.sent1: My brother can be a cussos when he gets angry.
meanings.sent2: The cussos at the party made everyone uncomfortable.
meanings.sent3: The cussos in the movie kept getting bleeped out for saying bad words.
meanings.sent4: The little boy was shocked to hear a cussos in the supermarket.
meanings.sent5: The teacher had to speak to the cussos about their language in class.

meanings.definition: To swear or use vulgar language.
meanings.sent1: Please don't cussos in front of the children.
meanings.sent2: He tends to cussos when he's frustrated with his work.
meanings.sent3: The parrot learned to cussos from listening to the sailors on the dock.
meanings.sent4: The angry driver began to cussos loudly at the traffic jam.
meanings.sent5: She felt embarrassed after accidentally cussosing in the library.

meanings.sent1: He shouted a cussos when he stubbed his toe.
meanings.sent2: The children giggled when they heard the cussos from the movie.
meanings.sent3: The old book was full of cussos that were no longer used.
meanings.sent4: She whispered a cussos under her breath when she lost her keys.
meanings.sent5: The comedian's routine was filled with cleverly placed cussos for humor.
